etymology.description: semantic: 廾(廾) (gǒng, "two hands") + phonetic: 㡀(㡀) (bì, "cloak") = hands holding a torn cloak -> rags
etymology.interpretation: The character 敝(bì, "rags") uses the 廾(廾) (gǒng, "two hands") as a semantic component to indicate actions done by hands, combined with the phonetic 㡀(㡀) (bì, "cloak") to suggest a worn or torn piece of clothing.
